reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved this hotel and were so glad to have discovered it through Travel and Leisure since our travel agent was not familiar with it. It is not even in the same league as its sister Taj property (Gateway Hotel), which is at the lower end of the Taj chain. This hotel is a beautiful guest house, gorgeously furnished and beautifully maintained. There is an extremely attractive swimming pool, which I had to myself each time I used it. The staff aims to please but is never intrusive. There are no rules here--the staff advises you that it is "your house" and they will accommodate you as to any request. The hotel is certainly in stark contrast to the energy of Varanasi. This is the only place to stay!
reviews.title: Intimate and Luxurious

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: With only 10 vast rooms, the Nadesur is elegant, discreet, personal and yes, palatial - in the true sense of the word. A wonderful quiet retreat from the hurly burly of Varanasi and the ghats. It's probably one of the finest "hotels" in the world.
reviews.title: Probably one of the finest
Fabulous!
reviews.text: Pampered in the Queen Elizabeth Suite, our stay at the Nadesar Palace was one of the highlights of our recent trip to India. The staff, chef, yoga instructor, spa staff were the best. This is a palace with a heart. Words cannot express the feeling of warmth and care that the staff provide. The Nadesar Palace is a treasure. Don't miss it. But you need to book early, as there are only 10 historic suites.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: An excellent small country house style hotel.It is an interesting historical building surrounded by large, peaceful gardens which are still rather new with a lot of new planting going on now. The staff were most helpful and seemed to easily outnumber the guests.A most enjoyable stay.
reviews.title: Most likely the best in Varanasi

reviews.text: we were 4 in no. and went there for 3 days just to have visit varanasi. the city is wonderful, its ghats, viswanath temple, sarnath, etc.
reviews.title: loved the palace

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were extremely happy with our stay at the Taj. The building is unimpressive from the outside but it is set in a beautiful garden. After a hectic day in the cities, walking through the small allies of Benares, it felt great to get back there every evening. The place is just right. The manager and the rest of the staff are very friendly.
reviews.title: Best in Benares

reviews.text: We had a very pleasant room. Every morning the house keeper would create a different animal with a towel and lay it on the bed, with additional rose petals. That was very sweet.
reviews.title: A royal palace!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They also helped us make travel changes for our train ride to Calcutta and gave good advices. There are two restaurants. The Mughlai cuisine restaurant is particularly good. The cafe is also just right. crispy pizzas and the rest. There is large size pool and other activities are on offer.
reviews.title: Expensive but worth it

reviews.text: It always feels special when you stay at one of those palace- converted -to hotels in India. This is a huge property in Banaras, and although the town and the surroundings are very dirty and crowded, once you enter this hotel, you are transformed into a different world! It really does feel like the home of the maharajas.
reviews.title: A Wonderful Maiden Visit
This is the best in Varanasi
reviews.text: Delightful 10 room boutique hotel converted from a summer palace. The room is delightful with a large bathroom. Outdoor porch outside room overlooking gardens ideal for relaxing. Service very attentive and caring. There is no elevator, so if there is a problem with stairs be sure to reserve first floor room. Very nice pool.

The restaurant which is very small is adequete and the staff accomodating. The staff's English is not of the standard that one expects at this level hotel, but they try very hard. Recently opened, so they are trying to iron some of the kinks out.
reviews.title: Characterful and memorable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for two nights over the Diwalli break. The Hotel grounds are wonderful, the rooms are nicely furnished although a bit smaller than we were expecting. It feels more like someone's home than a hotel. Especially as they had a superb library of very interesting books available to guests. A real highlight.
reviews.title: Really great experience... The best ever!

reviews.text: The staff were very enthusiastic although seemed far less professional than those in its big sister hotel which resides in the same grounds. We really appreciated the effort the staff made to entertain the kids. The cooks took our boys off on a horse carriage ride one afternoon. What was a bit odd is that the hotel seemed too reliant on the sister hotel's kitchen. The food and wine wasn't always available as described.
reviews.title: Quality Time to spend

likes.disliked: — Travel Desk was suppose to inform us about the travel route but did not get back to us

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We hadn't realised how far out the hotel is from Varanasi's main sites. Varanasi's traffic was almost as bad as Bangalore's. If you want to be near the action and be able to wander the backstreets of Varanasi this is not the hotel for you. If you want to escape the intensity of the city then it is a good option.
reviews.title: Not quite there...
